SEARCH
Package io.github.jidcoo.opto.lcdb.enhancer.base

Interface Strategizable<AcceptableType,Output,Strategy>

All Superinterfaces:
Order
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseParameterAcceptStrategy, BasePrintingStrategy, BinaryTreeParameterAcceptStrategy, BinaryTreePrintingStrategy, GodParameterAcceptStrategy, SinglyLinkedListParameterAcceptStrategy, SinglyLinkedListPrintingStrategy
public interface Strategizable<AcceptableType,Output,Strategy> extends Order

Strategizable is an interface for object acceptance strategies.

Note: Strategizable extends from the Order, please do not forget to implement the Order.getOrder() method. Because it will directly reflect the priority of this strategizable object!!!

Since:
1.0
Author:
Jidcoo

    • getObjectType

      default Class<?> getObjectType(Object object)
      Get the object type.

      Return NullType if the object is null.

      Parameters:
      object - the object to be accepted.
      Returns:
      the object type.

    • checkObjectAcceptable

      default void checkObjectAcceptable(Object object)
      Check the object can accept for this acceptable class.
      Parameters:
      object - the object.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the accepted type get from getAcceptableType() is null or the object is not accepted for this acceptable class.

    • findStrategySet

      default Set<Strategy> findStrategySet(Object object, Map<Class<?>,Set<Strategy>> strategiesMap)

      Find the most appropriate acceptance strategy set for the object to be accepted.

      Parameters:
      object - the object to be accepted.
      strategiesMap - the available accepting strategies map. The key is the output object class to which this Strategy applies. The value is a set of strategy with the same accepted type. And the set is sorted the priority of strategy based on getOrder().
      Returns:
      the strategy set.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if not find any appropriate strategy set for the object.

    • accept

      default Output accept(Object classType, Object object, Map<Class<?>,Set<Strategy>> strategiesMap) throws Throwable
      Accept the object by the class type.
      Parameters:
      classType - the class type.
      object - the object.
      strategiesMap - the strategies map that can be used during the acceptance process.
      Returns:
      the accepted output.
      Throws:
      Throwable
